javafx.scene.control

Class TreeView.EditEvent<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • javafx.event.Event
        • javafx.scene.control.TreeView.EditEvent<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the input, which is the same type as the TreeView itself.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    TreeView<T>

    public static class TreeView.EditEvent<T>
extends Event
    An Event subclass used specifically in TreeView for representing edit-related events. It provides additional API to easily access the TreeItem that the edit event took place on, as well as the input provided by the end user.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class javafx.event.Event

        ANY, consumed, eventType, NULL_SOURCE_TARGET, target

      Constructor and Description
      TreeView.EditEvent(TreeView<T> source, EventType<? extends TreeView.EditEvent> eventType, TreeItem<T> treeItem, T oldValue, T newValue)
      Creates a new EditEvent instance to represent an edit event.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getNewValue()
      Returns the new value input into the TreeItem by the end user.
      T getOldValue()
      Returns the old value that existed in the TreeItem prior to the current edit event.
      TreeView<T> getSource()
      Returns the TreeView upon which the edit took place.
      TreeItem<T> getTreeItem()
      Returns the TreeItem upon which the edit took place.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeView.EditEvent

        public TreeView.EditEvent(TreeView<T> source,
                  EventType<? extends TreeView.EditEvent> eventType,
                  TreeItem<T> treeItem,
                  T oldValue,
                  T newValue)
        Creates a new EditEvent instance to represent an edit event. This event is used for TreeView.EDIT_START_EVENT, TreeView.EDIT_COMMIT_EVENT and TreeView.EDIT_CANCEL_EVENT types.
